creditline: Gift of Leonard H. Bernheim Jr., Class of 1959

texts.textentryhtml:
Reportedly found in a burial in the vicinity of Pomacanchi, Acomayo province, Peru [1]. By August 1978, private collection, Peru [2]. By 1980, possibly the Merrin Gallery, New York, sold to Leonard H. Bernheim (1937-2000) Jr., New York [3]; 1982, gift of Bernheim to the Princeton University Art Museum .

Notes:
[1] According to Sergio Jorge Chávez, “Funerary Offerings from a Middle Horizon Context in Pomacanchi, Cuzco,” Ñawpa Pacha 22-23:1-48.
[2] ibid.
[3] y1982-27 through y1982-29 were on loan from Bernheim to the Princeton University Art Museum beginning in 1980 (L.1980.151). That the Merrin Gallery was their source is according to correspondence with Stephanie Bernheim, who recalled this but was not certain. Cory in the curatorial file

bibliography.boilertext: Princeton University Art Museum: Handbook of the Collections (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2013)
bibliography.citation: Princeton University Art Museum: Handbook of the Collections (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2013), p. 111

bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1982", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 42, no. 1 (1983): p. 50-70., pp. 69–70 (illus.)

bibliography.citation: Susan E. Bergh, ed., Wari: Lords of the Ancient Andes (New York; Cleveland: Thames and Hudson, The Cleveland Museum of Art, 2012)., fig. 12b, cat. no. 91 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Sergio Jorge Chavez, "Funerary Offerings from a Middle Horizon Context in Pomacanchi, Cuzco," Ñawpa Pacha 22/23 (1984/5): 1-48.
bibliography.citation: Sergio Jorge Chavez, "Funerary Offerings from a Middle Horizon Context in Pomacanchi, Cuzco," Ñawpa Pacha 22/23 (1984/5): 1-48., fig. 17, p. 38 (illus. line drawing)
